qa.q: Do you want to perform data detection from your local machine or a remote machine?
What is the hostname or IP address of the remote machine that will perform data collection?
What type of data collection would you like to perform?

choice.a: Take a network capture of traffic that occurs during the fuzzing iteration.
Save a file generated locally to the machine performing data collection.
Save a remote file via SSH.

qa.q: What is the network device to perform the network capture on?

Optionally, provide a PCAP filter rule to limit the network traffic collected. If no filter is provided, all traffic will be collected. A guide to writing PCAP filter rules is available at http://google.com/?q=pcap+filter.
Enter the file name you would like to save. The file will be collected at the end of a faulting iteration. The file will not be deleted.
What is the remote host that will be connected to using SSH? Enter the hostname or IP address.
What username would you like to connect as? If this field is left blank, the current users username will be used.
What type of authentication should be used?
Enter the password to use for authenticating to the remote host.
Enter full path to private key file to use for authentication to the remote host.
Would you like to download a single file, or a folder of files?
Enter the filename with full path to download.
Should the file be removed after being downloaded?

choice.a: Yes, remove the file after downloading it.
No, do not remove the file.
